website_summaries.verdict: This pet belt connects to the safety latch instead of the seat belt itself for better safety.
pros: Adjusts between 16 and 26 inches in length to create a comfortable fit
The pet tether's configuration eliminates the chance of the dog unhooking the belt
Uses a swivel attachment to allow the dog to rotate without tangling
cons: May not be able to support the weight of a large dog in a crash

customer_reviews.title: My car was totaled because of front end demolished and my husband and I were hurt severely but our Joy remained seated belted in her Mighty Paw safety belt ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for our 25lb cocker spaniel after doing a lot of research and just 2 wks ago it was tested. Our ford focus was Tboned by a truck with us going 54 miles per hr on impact. My car was totaled because of front end demolished and my husband and I were hurt severely but our Joy remained seated belted in her Mighty Paw safety belt and didn't suffer any injury. I'm only buying another because hers was tested already and I want to remain safe. Have told all hospital staff and every dog owner I know about this wonderful safety belt.
customer_reviews.author: laura christofoli

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous!!! Please read!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't often write negative reviews on pet items, but this one seriously needs a BIG warning: Proceed with major caution if using this with more than one dog!!!!!! I got this for my new dog who could not keep his little butt out of the front seat. Once restrained in the back, he started moving around back there. Which ended up with him somehow wrapped around my other dog's midsection so tightly I had to cut first this belt then both dog's harness to untangle them. I have never been so panicked!! To think my poor boy could have been seriously, seriously injured or worse had I not heard a strange noise from the back and turned around.
customer_reviews.author: 🌟 Emma Elizabeth 🌟

customer_reviews.title: It is as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: The latch clip works great in the back of our SUV. Though my son hates getting drooled on by the puppy, but he prefers that than getting sat on. Lol Carabeaner works well, we've had this for a month or so and use it daily. We have a 90 pound Weimaraner and he's able to sit, stand and lay down.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Keep's Our Dog Safe!
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to feel like harnessing a dog in a car is restricting for them, but it is a matter of safety. In sudden stops or accidents, the dog can be thrown through a window. Please use a harness with this on your dog instead of a collar. A sudden stop with a collar can break a dog’s neck. This attaches easily to the seat latch bars meant to attach car seats with a safety lock. The safety lock is easy to remove but will not accidentally unlatch The other end is a carabiner that is secure but easy to attach and detach. The belt is easy to adjust but remains secure after adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: D. Porrey

customer_reviews.title: Amazing but a little short
customer_reviews.text: Love this, just wish it were just a tad bit longer. Fully extended this is a bit short and while it restricts my dog from coming to the front of the car, it limits his overall movement due to the fact that I don’t use a harness. So when my dog is clipped in on his collar he can barely stick his nose out the window which he loves doing during the car ride. With that said, I love this because my dog can’t come to the front of the car and block my view and he doesn’t get tangled nearly as much as when I was using a headrest attachment.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Dog Nearly Lost a Paw
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how this happened, but my dog managed to impale her toe on the non-carabiner end of this seat belt. After being strapped in, she impaled her toe on the clamp (to where it looked like her toe was pierced!). She was unable to walk and had an emergency vet visit (that fortunately was able to remove the belt without permanent injury...although I could have seen it getting that way in not much longer!) This product seems like such a great idea, but after 2 hours in the pet ER, I have to say I am not inclined to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mutive

customer_reviews.title: The perfect dog seat belt
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. I have 2 large dogs, and lab/rott mix and a Berner, so I needed something strong and secure. The belt is super easy to install and high quality. The adjustable length is great because I have bought other safety harnesses but since I was hooking to the child safety restraints in the back of my jeep they simply were not long enough. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate size chart, difficulty with return
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 harnesses and 2 safety straps. My dogs fall in the medium size range according to the measurements I took in the areas of their bodies shown on the product size chart. The harness is way too tight on the largest dog and too snug to allow for any weight gain on the other. I planned to return all four pieces, but the return will only refund me for one set! I guess I'll keep one of them and not do business with this company again. The harness and strap looks fine, would have kept both had they been the correct size.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: It's a great product, except it's too short.
customer_reviews.text: I love how easily the belt attaches and that my dog can no longer step on the seatbelt release and free herself. The belt also seems very well made. BUT... it is TOO SHORT! I want it to be at least 3-5" longer. It might not provide as much protection that way, but the dog would be happier on a longer leash. After using this for a couple of months, I'm adding 2 stars to my rating - 1) it's still too short, but it works, and the quality is good, 2) after reading my review, Mighty Paw contacted me to make things right and really impressed me with their sincerity. They're good people to do business with and support!
customer_reviews.author: annekohl

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my dog gets anxious in the car and cannot maintain her balance. She's a German Shepard weighing in at 88 lbs at our last vet visit. I just connected this product to the back seat of my car, then to her harness and life was good! She still gets a little anxious but can now balance easier, and is MUCH SAFER in the car. We went on a 3 hour ride to Delaware to visit family and then stayed two days and 3 hours back and God it was SO MUCH EASIER with this product. SO HAPPY! Before I bought this I was nervous to take her anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Soooo glad and pleased...
customer_reviews.text: I am soooo glad and pleased that I found this kind of seatbelt as the kind I had, where you connect the end in the seatbelt connector, would disconnect at any time when one of my Airedale terrier dogs would step on it. They latch real easy on the latch bar under the seat. I no longer have to wonder or worry about them becoming loose in the back seat. The lengths are great too and very easy to attach to my dogs. Love that the clip is big and swivels. This is a BIG 5 star for me!
customer_reviews.author: Airedale Mom

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 5-month-old chocolate lab, whom we walk with a harness, rather than a collar. In reviewing different harness attachments for riding in a vehicle, I settled upon this one. I like the idea our dog can move around, only as far as we adjust the length for her, and she can turn around without tangling in the belt. It has a swivel hook that attaches to her harness. The seat belt attaches inside the vehicle's seat where you would clip in a child's car seat. We recently took a trip (4 hours each way), and the seat belt worked great for (1) her safety, and (2) keeping her out of the front seat!
customer_reviews.author: Deb M.

customer_reviews.title: Not Rated High Enough!
customer_reviews.text: The clip on this belt is not rated high enough. It is only rated at 880 lbs and the caribeaner attached isnt rated properly and that doesn't convince me that it'll stop my 80 lb German Shepherd in a car accident.
customer_reviews.author: DJean

customer_reviews.title: Terrific addition to harness!
customer_reviews.text: My Jack Russel/Boston Terrier just started using this terrific seatbelt with it's great tangle free swivel attachment. It enables her to ride on the middle seat of my Highlander in great comfort and gives her room to look out windows on each side, while keeping her safely in position. It is a tremendous relief to not worry about her becoming a flying object in case of an accident. The seatbelt attachment is very easy to install, and quickly is positioned. I highly recommend it for safety, ease of use and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Anne B.

customer_reviews.title: He did great, and was much calmer with this attached
customer_reviews.text: When my dog got tired of the booster seat, I switched over to this so that he could lay freely (er, mostly) on the back bench seat. He did great, and was much calmer with this attached. As a driver, I, too, was much calmer, and this seemed to hold him better and be less jarring during sudden braking than the booster seat. The Mighty Paw Safety Belt, along with a hammock-style backseat cover, and a few comfy blankets tucked in for good measure meant my dog snoozed, I felt better knowing he was secure, and driving ~300 miles didn't suck so much. I recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safe and secure!
customer_reviews.text: This safety belt makes me feel so much better driving with my puppy. I keep it fully extended for my 40lb husky, and that’s a good length. She can still reach the windows but can’t jump out, and she can nudge me in the front seat but can’t jump to the front. I used to use a safety belt that clicked into a seatbelt, but she would step on the release button and get out. This belt prevents that problem! Make sure you clip it to a harness, NOT to a collar!
customer_reviews.author: Live.Laugh.Love.

customer_reviews.title: Good design
customer_reviews.text: I have a booster car seat for my small dog, so she sits up high and can see out the window. I used a pair of these belts, one on each latch connection point, to create an anchor point that sits just above the booster seat. The car seat belt goes through both carabiners. Adjusted the length of each strap to minimize the side-to-side travel distance of the anchor (in case of a car accident). Then I have a short tether from the anchor point to my dog's harness.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Hartman

customer_reviews.title: 40 pound labradoodle likes it!
customer_reviews.text: We have had a hard time finding something that works for our 40 pound carsick Aussie Labradoodle. Finally this works and she likes it. We use it with a harness that attaches at her back (instead of the harness that we walk her in which attaches at her front). It's easy to use. We can keep it in the car hooked up because it doesn't take up any space. It's always there. We always use it. I hope we'll never have to test it, but it's good to know it's there.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Goldman-Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was longer.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great safety belt. I chose to latch it to the car seat latch behind the seat so that it could be above my dog and allow them to make their circles before laying down without getting tangled up. The carabiner is GREAT! I use the Ruffwear travel vest on my dogs and it has a wide band that does best with something like a carabiner. Only downside is it’s length. Even when fully extended is “just long enough” to reach my chihuahua. My whippet has much more freedom to move around on the seat because she’s taller.
customer_reviews.author: grayellow

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my little 5 pound pup. He doesn’t get tangled up at all. The metal part of the harness will get hot if you leave it in the car. It’s also really hard to remove from the seat anchor which is perfect for safty but sucks when you want to switch cars. So I’m just going to buy another one for the other car we use. I think this is safer than the other option where in goes into the seat belt buckle. Your dog may be able to push the button by accident. You can use any harness with this if you want.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly

customer_reviews.title: More secure the ones that clasp into the car seatbelt
customer_reviews.text: The only type of dog seatbelt that I had before was the one where you click it into the car seatbelt so I wasn’t sure about if I wanted one that clasped onto the bar, but it is soo much better. It snugly clasps onto the bar, but is easy to take out. It feels a lot more secure than the one that goes into the car seatbelt. I would definitely recommend trying this type instead of the other type.
customer_reviews.author: Ames Eggerbee

customer_reviews.title: Controlled freedom
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I hooked one end to the metal bar in the crease of the back seat, and the other to harnesses on my dogs. I have 2 wonderful, but high energy Weimaraners. Restricting their movements keeps them calm...and all of us safe while driving. They can't jump around the back seat, but still have enough freedom to stick their heads out of the window, or to lay down if they choose.
customer_reviews.author: kstay

customer_reviews.title: Great seatbelt for my schnauzer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my miniature schnauzer that weighs 18 pounds sometimes flies off the seat if he sits tied by a leash to the seatbelt. Sometimes if the belt did not lock quickly enough when I made a turn, he would fall off the seat. This belt however is restrictive and locked. I can set it exactly right and he stays in place the entire drive. It keeps him out of my lap and comfortably happy being able to sit down or stand up and look out the window. I highly recommend this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Seat belt Ever
customer_reviews.text: We had another seat belt from a different seller here on amazon, and it clicked into the holder. Our pup would constantly step on it, releasing the belt. I love that this one connects to the child safety belts so our pup can't get out of it. I do wish that it could to a little longer. Our pup is about 60lbs, and he is tall. It can be hard to clip it into the harness because it is a little short.
customer_reviews.author: Madi K

customer_reviews.title: I love this belt!
customer_reviews.text: I love this safety belt! My dog was beginning to develop some anxieties in the car and would hop over the seats to be near me. This was a scary no-no! This belt had been a lifesaver! I just clip him in and he stays roughly in the same spot until I let him out. It is a little difficult to clip it in the car clip-in location which seems to be hidden in some cars but other than that it's pretty easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: R.H

customer_reviews.title: MUCH better than the seatbelt latch types
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a seatbelt-type dog buckle. I ordered this because I thought that the dog will eventually step on the seatbelt latch and unlatch himself. A couple days after I ordered this, that's exactly what he did! While it wasn't a big deal, I sure am glad I ordered this. I used it for the first time the other day and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Nerditup

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for...x2
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and works perfectly. Update 9/26/19: I was so impressed by the quality and functionality of this dog seat belt, that I purchased a second one for my husband’s SUV. We now have one in each of our vehicles. I use it with a harness that includes a back clip and I feel extremely confident that our dog will be safer should we have to break abruptly or if we were in an accident. This is a great product and it clips easily to the metal car seat attachment in the seat as opposed to using the seatbelt.
customer_reviews.author: F. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Safety First
customer_reviews.text: I have seen products like this for a while now and never invested in any. However, after having a very scary close call(hit breaks and dog went out the window thankfully when we were only going about 1mph!) I realized the importance of having a tether. So after researching and looking at the ones that clipped into the buckel. I saw that a lot of people had issues with those not fitting or getting stuck. I then came across this and it fits and works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: aTacticalBeard

customer_reviews.title: Works great except
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Strong, adjustable, holds my 125 lb mastiff. The problem is the latch that attaches to the car. I use the anchor points in the cargo area, so if you go thru the seats as the pics show it’s fine. But if You latch them in the cargo area of an SUV, my dog steps all over it, unhooking himself easily and then getting the latch stuck on his feet. He does it a lot and I can usually unclip him no prob, but yesterday the clip wedged between two toes and it was a traumatic couple hours getting it off. I’m looking for one now that has a different style latch
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps dogs safe
customer_reviews.text: I bought three! Two that hook to the baby seat latches. I use those in the third row of my minivan when both my dogs are riding. I have the one that attaches to the seat belt for the front row passenger seat. I really like them. My dogs like to ride along when I drop the kids off at school and with the safety leashes I don’t have to worry about them deciding to join them. I am very satisfied with my purchases!
customer_reviews.author: kismet

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I just got a bad one?
customer_reviews.text: I want to give this product 5 stars because I love that it attaches to the child seat bar. My dog steps on the ones attached to the seatbelt and (accidentally?) releases herself occasionally. We bought 2 of these, one for each car. One has held up really well and I love it. The other I believe is defective. It started shredding at the base and then the dog of course decided to help it out.
customer_reviews.author: dpink

customer_reviews.title: Works great, hooks to frame, not seatbelt, which I wanted. Avoid if you own a chewer, because they can chew right through it.
customer_reviews.text: It looked and felt very strong. I like the way it hooks to the frame of your car and not your seatbelt. I think it’s more stable that way. But, if you have a chewer, find another one on Amazon that is a rapped cable. I never thought my dog would, but he did chew right through it. Too bad! I really liked knowing my dog was strapped in and safe. The belt is adjustable too, which makes it nice too. I purchased the matching vest with it. The vest is holding up well, but I had to order the covered no chew strap to replace this.
customer_reviews.author: CO Fiddle Gal

customer_reviews.title: Love them so much I bought two more for my other car!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two and am very pleased. Works very well at securing both my doberman and my boxer. Plenty of length that they can move a bit without fear of them falling or jumping out of the car when I open the door.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and secure
customer_reviews.text: It’s sturdy and feels quite secure to me, being attached to a child seat latch. I also like the size of the clip, which accommodates her new harness well. Much better than the flimsy booster seat attachment we were using. I would love it if someone made a dog booster that utilized that latch system like this. In the meantime, the adjustability of the strap lets us continue to use the booster, and actually lets her sit or sniff at the window more comfortably. This is a great inexpensive option for dog car safety.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hathaway

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money 💰
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my labs so they’d be able to safely ride in my Jeep Wrangler with the top off. I love that they can securely snap to the car seat anchors on the front or backs of the seats. So far they hold up well with my 9 month old puppy. This is a fairly cheap extra sense of security to use for fun with our dogs. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Ok for movement restriction, look elsewhere for collision protection
customer_reviews.text: These seem well made (double stitched webbing, strong buckles, etc), they just have the exact same weak point as all if these things: a little rivet used to facilitate permitting the connector (in this case a carabiner) to swivel passing a little knob through a whole in a thin peice of metal. In a collision, the webbing will hold, the carabiner will remain intact (probably...there's no kN rating on it) but I very much doubt that even 10 pounds of dog suddenly hurled forward will be held by that. The forces involved are so great that the only dog harness independently collision rated is certified using a passthrough seatbelt attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I have a 50 lb Siberian husky who is rambunctious and doesn't travel well in my 2009 Pontiac Vibe. We fold down the backseats of our hatchback. As I drive my pup tries to come into the front seat which is dangerous while I am driving. In the back on either side there are tiedown metal bars that I can latch the safety belt to. The perfect length of the belt allows him to still look out the window but not come into the console of the front seat but only lay his head there. So I love it. No more yelling on the way to the dog park. Everyone is happy
customer_reviews.author: Laura P.

customer_reviews.title: Safe and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Love these to keep my pups safe and secure. I have a Nissan Murano and love to take my two dogs to the dog park. They get very excited when we arrive and it is hard for me to keep them from jumping out by myself. These keep them safe in the back of the car until I can unhook them and have them safe in hand. These are adjustable so I can have them long enough so the dogs can move around comfortably but not so long that they can jump out and hang themselves. Latches and straps are sturdy and easy to attach to the car and the dog harnesses.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller hook poor quality
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our boxer traveling to and from the dog park. Since it's first use we have had problems with the smaller hook springing and our dog becoming loose in the car. We have tried all possible combinations of what end is attached to our dog and to the car, and where it is attached to her harness (neck or chest). It may work better for our 15 lb dog and will try it on him but I do not recommend it for a 50 lb dog.
customer_reviews.author: Sweltering

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have it in the back seat, my service dog has never liked riding in the front My rear seat has the set up for baby carriers with the toggle. The safety belt fits in those perfectly, and I have a jacket that basically covers his chest and under his belly. I hope we never have see if it works, but I'm sure it will. Pleased with the purchase, and the well made product!
customer_reviews.author: smitty319

customer_reviews.title: Very well made, strong pet safety belt!!
customer_reviews.text: This seat belt is very well made, strong and will work perfect when travelling with our furbaby. She's approx 20#, very lean, long bodied w/really long legs. We haven't had op to use it yet but we've installed it to check it out. She should be able to sit and lay confortably - just enough movement to give her some options without roving from driver to passenger and endangering herself or others. Perfect solution, thanks for a great product!!
customer_reviews.author: kerry

customer_reviews.title: Safer than seat belt buckles!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic seat belt! I had one from another company that clicked into the seatbelt buckle, but my dog stepped on it, unbuckled himself and jumped out of the car window! We were stopped in a parking space, but I stopped using that seat belt immediately. I have this one locked into the latch behind the headrest in the back seat, and it stays there and works great.
customer_reviews.author: MrsWhovian

customer_reviews.title: I feel safer using this!
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to connect and use - it makes me feel so much better about having my dog in the car securely with her harness, and it also keeps her from getting on the floorboards to look for crumbs. I wish it were a tiny touch longer but she can still put her head out the window or on the center console to rest between us.
customer_reviews.author: Ange Ailesnoires

customer_reviews.title: Keeps coming undone from harness. Would be great if it had a locking caribeaner
customer_reviews.text: The anchor clip, strap, & caribeaner seem well made. I was impressed when it first arrived. However, every time I've used it so far, 1 of the 2 D-rings on my dogs harness have come undone, and one time the harness came completely unsecured. If this was just a little longer & had a locking caribeaner, I'd rate it 5*... However, I need to send it back because it cannot stay connected to my dogs harness.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: Great thus far!
customer_reviews.text: Originally I had the cheap belt that clicked into the seatbelt buckle and it would not keep it's short length. The fabric was cheap and it was poorly made. This product, on the other hand, is amazing! I love that it clips onto the car seat anchor and it is a very sturdy product! The caribiner hold well and seems sturdy enough but only time will tell!
customer_reviews.author: Corey R. Swann

customer_reviews.title: Better than the seat belt kind
customer_reviews.text: I use it for my 80 lb lab. When attached to the ring at the top of the seat, It’s a smidge too short for him to lay down without his harness pulling uncomfortably tight. I added a 3 inch carabiner to the end and it fixed the issue. But for everyday use... there’s plenty of length to look out both windows. You do have to keep an eye on the dog as they can turn around and get it looped around their neck. This is better than the kind that attaches into the seat belt... my dog kept unlatching that kind.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Securing Dog to Car Seat
customer_reviews.text: I needed a harness for securing my dog in the vehicle. I bought the attachment lead for securing to the safety clip inside the seat. There is enough room for him to move, but short enough to keep him on the seat. I like how it secures between the seat and backseat (close to the seatbelt clips) using the child safety clips that are in all new vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Ken and Lisa

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy Duty and works like a charm. Clips on D ring in the cargo space in the back of our Honda CRV and keeps my Boxer in the back instead of him jumping over the back seat, Does not clip into a seat belt. I got one also that clips into a seat belt for when he rides in the front passenger seat. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so far so good. Dog stayed in back seat and was secured ...
customer_reviews.text: I transport dogs from the shelter to the spay and neuter clinic weekly. I tried using the seat belt clips but the big dogs kept stepping on the button and would unlatch themselves. Tried this product this morning, so far so good. Dog stayed in back seat and was secured when I opened the door.
customer_reviews.author: Mel P

customer_reviews.title: Gotta keep the Pooch safe
customer_reviews.text: At 90 pounds its esp scary to think of my Pit flying around the cabin in the event of an accident. I like that this attaches to the car seat anchor and not the seatbelt. I think it provides more stability and there is no chance of an accidental release. I hope that this is never put to the ultimate test, but it does offer peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Clay fioravanti

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my 80 lb lab out of the front seat while we aer going to the park..
customer_reviews.text: This does what other seat belt types of restraints couldn't do...stay attached while driving my extremely strong and single minded female Lab keeping her in the back seat. The clip that goes on to the child seat restraint is great and even encourages Trix to lie down and relax. Well worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Blakeney

customer_reviews.title: Does the job. Plain and simple.
customer_reviews.text: This leash does exactly what it is made to do. Simple as that. Very strong clips on both ends. Adjustable straps. I have mine almost completely extended and my dog still can not get to the front seat (65lb black lab). You will need to keep an eye on your dog to make sure they do not chew on the nylon part if it's the first time they have been restrained in the car. After they get used to it, it is a night and day difference. Keeps your dog safe but also allows you to focus on driving instead of constantly pushing your them to the back seat if they get excited. I would highly suggest this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a dream!
customer_reviews.text: Used this with our corgi for a 20+ hour drive and it worked perfectly! Easily installed into the vehicle and clipped smoothly to our pupper's harness. The carabiner/swivel combination is the best thing ever. We'd previously used a Kurgo brand restraint that latched into the seatbelt and did not have a swivel. It would get so twisted after only 15 minutes in the car that at times it even unlatched itself from the dog's harness! So happy to finally switch to this restraint, it was a lifesaver on long trips.
customer_reviews.author: IndoMK

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: Definitely recommend this. I bought the harness to go with this. I have purchased other seat belts before and they didn't seem as secure. I like that this clips to the seat itself and seems a lot safer. My dog pulls a lot and at 70lbs this keeps him in place. He's able to hang his head out the window, but not climb out. He can reach us in the front seat with his nose, but not jump or interfere with our driving. I feel that if we had to slam on brakes or got in an accident, that this would keep him safer and from going too far.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Does the job. I liked that she didn't fly between the front seats when I had to slam on the brakes. She needs to learn not to try to jump out when I open the door... it leaves her hanging (harness) and I have to lift her to get enough slack to unhook her. MUST use with harness, not collar. Dog could easily be decapitated if used with a collar.
customer_reviews.author: MElder

customer_reviews.title: Drive safe with Rover
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to install and use. There's a clip that attaches to the bar behind the back seat. The other end of the belt has a carabiner-type clip for the dog's harness. (Always use a harness, sold separately, not a collar.) The belt is long enough to allow the dog not to feel confined to one spot. She can look out the window or change position, but she won't be able to climb into your lap or go rocketing around the car because something interesting is going on outside. If you have to slam on the brakes, this is the safest way for her to absorb impact.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Esterhammer-Fic

customer_reviews.title: Useful for short car rides
customer_reviews.text: When used with the Mighty Paw harness, it's been very effective in giving my dog the freedom to move around, lie down and look out the window, but still secure him during sharp turns and acceleration. My dog doesn't like to sit in the car, he stands for 80% of the time and tends to get shifted around while accelerating etc, but this belt keeps him from hitting the front seats or landing on the floorboard very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what we were looking for as a way to prevent aesthetic damage and after using them realize how much more comfortable our dogs are being secured
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these for our english bulldogs. They are being used in the back seat (folded down seats) of a Toyota Tacoma and if you hook them to the bottom hook in the center of the back they have just enough give to stand and move around a little without getting up on the window ledge or center console. This is exactly what we were looking for as a way to prevent aesthetic damage and after using them realize how much more comfortable our dogs are being secured.
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: Much more secure than the seatbelt connector!
customer_reviews.text: I love that this item connects to the latch. It is much more secure than my previous seatbelt connected one from Blueberry. Previously, on multiple occasions, I have parked the car realizing that my dog stepped on the seatbelt and released the harness. With this harness, I know it will stay secure. It’s also super easy to connect to the latch. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never going back to the other pet seatbelts
customer_reviews.text: Great product! It lasted longer than any other seatbelt with my dog! It is so nice to have the clip not go into the seatbelt click because those seem to come undone easier but these stay in place! My dog chewed through most of it but took him longer than the other seatbelts we bought previously
customer_reviews.author: Jill A. Limberg

customer_reviews.title: Keep Puppy Safe!
customer_reviews.text: This seat belt is so very easy to install. We use the Mighty Paw harness with it. We got this safety system because our Airedale puppy was outgrowing the crate that would fit in our SUV. Took our first trip yesterday. She whined a bit at first (as she does at anything new), but then settled in nicely on the back seat. I didn't "whine" though because I knew she as safe and secure.
customer_reviews.author: GramC

customer_reviews.title: Safety first
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for both our dogs. Perfect product for our needs. It’s strong and sturdy. Fits on the car seat hook in between the seats so we don’t have to use a seatbelt. The clip swivels smoothly so our dogs can move to readjust and yet remain LT safely secure during car rides.
customer_reviews.author: D-shopper

customer_reviews.title: Glad we got this!
customer_reviews.text: I'm honestly shocked our dog doesn't hate using this, as he had grown accustomed to standing with his front paws on the center console to see our the front of the car (not anymore!). He can still move around in the back seat/look out the back windows, but of course we feel much better knowing that he's secure. This seems to be one of the best options on the market as it connects to the bars behind the back seats. It's super easy to install and we use it with a Puppia harness we already had (we just leave it attached to the seatbelt in the car when not being used).
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Great dog seat belt
customer_reviews.text: We had a small problem with finding the latch in our car & if it was an inch longer, I would have given it a 5 star. Our dog likes to put his head right through the middle of our seats But that's just our dog. It's a great little seat belt & we feel much better having our dog on it. We travel a lot & my husband had something that he made previously but this is so much nicer. The company is very nice to deal with & I would order again from them. ,
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Good product, a must for a new pup
customer_reviews.text: Works great for keeping my aussie pup safe and also for preventing interference while driving. The most difficult part was figuring where to attach it in my car. However I just Google my car make and model to figure out where the tether snaps on. Pup doesn't mind it at all and he's a lot happier with this than going in a crate for our travels.
customer_reviews.author: Goatchick2014

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love that it hooks to the frame of the car and has a carabeener for the harness hook! Very sturdy! ***BUT BE CAREFUL*** I read a review that someone’s dog stepped on the part that attaches to the car and was hurt so be careful when you don’t have it installed but once it is it’s great. Also be carful your dog doesn’t jump out of the car when you open the door and they are still hooked up! My dog did this and wasn’t happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice construction, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I gave it five stars for construction, durability and ease of use. Thankfully we haven't had to test out the safety feature in a crash. I also like that you can lengthen and shorten it, although I may have it too long as it wraps around my pug's leg sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: becky

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my seat jumping coonhound!
customer_reviews.text: My coonhound always jumped into the front seat while I was driving which is super dangerous for both of us. I purchased the seat belt to stop that and for his overall safety in the car. He isn’t a fan of the seat belt since he can’t jump into the front anymore, but I love it! I feel much more at ease when I put him in the car now. Very easy to use and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Securing our dogs is easy!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. This is our second set, as we have a 6mo pup who travels well with us. Having your dog unsecured in your car is a setup for projectile dog. You’ll want to get a reasonably well made harness, to help absorb shock in case of a crash. You don’t want to use this one just the collar. You risk neck injuries without it
customer_reviews.author: Simeon E. Tauber

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use when you attach to back seat. You use the latch provided for child seats. The other end attaches to your provided dog halter which I had. We have not had a wreck or anything but I hope it helps if we do. Meanwhile I feel better with the dog restrained. Ok a year later with infrequent use, mainly long car trips, the carabiner broke and now I wonder how sturdy the whole affair might be. I need to buy a new carabiner. I use a halter and attached the carabiner to it. The dog just shifting around might have broke it but the part on the halter did not break, just the Mighty Paw part.
customer_reviews.author: Elaineconsumer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a safety harness that was to attach to a seat belt. It NEVER worked and my dog was miserable in it. Once he would lie down, the seat belt would lock and he couldn't get back up. We were both miserable. Mighty Paw is fantastic. Beau is able to sit, stand or lie down with ease and I know he is safe and secure! We both LOVE going for rides now! Be sure to always use a harness, never attach it to a collar!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Connects securely, appears well-made.
customer_reviews.text: Connects behind the seat securely, unlike the one we had that snapped into the seatbelt connector -- which instantly came unhooked when the dog stepped on the seatbelt latch! Appears well-made, delivered promptly. A (small) issue arose and the company responded quickly with a successful resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Owl at home

customer_reviews.title: ... and been looking for a long time for a good car leash/harness
customer_reviews.text: I own a 28lb welsh corgi and been looking for a long time for a good car leash/harness. I've found it with this great product. I love that it securely mounts to the baby seat loop build into every late model car and the carabiner side easily hooks onto my dog's harness. If there were a single complaint, it would be that i wish there was more room for adjusting it shorter. I have it at it's shortest length and half of my dog's body could probably hang off the front edge of the back seat. Would be perfect for anything larger than my dog.
customer_reviews.author: MCL

customer_reviews.title: Great for peace of mind while driving
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could feel a bit safer driving with my dog in the backseat and so I could put the windows down more than a crack without worrying he would jump out. It has worked great! My dog seems comfortable while it's in use and it does a great job of restraining him (80lbs) when he gets excited and wild seeing other animals. I have only used in in conjunction with the harness made by Mighty Paw, and they work wonderfully together. It was easy to install and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who drives with their dog.
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used the safety belts that click into the seatbelt and the dogs just have to accidentally step on the release and I now have loose dogs in the car. With this style belt it’s no longer an issue of accidental releases. I have the peace of mind that my dogs are safe and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Aby

customer_reviews.title: safety strap
customer_reviews.text: These are just the right size and length for securing your dog in the back seat. Keep your pet safe when traveling and not becoming a projectile if you should have to stop fast. I went with this brand coz everything looked much better made and I liked the clip at the end. Others didn't have this. It was also recommended by our trainer. Compared with others and this was the best.
customer_reviews.author: browneyz

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke third day.
customer_reviews.text: I’m hoping mine was defective. The strap broke behind the harness clip the third day we used it. Our dog is only 35 lbs. since this tether appears to be well made, the strap must have been defective. Will exchange for a replacement and update my review.
customer_reviews.author: bucky

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality item. I prefer this type over the ones to lock into seatbelt. It gives you more options on where to secure it which is what we needed travelling with 4 dogs on a move cross country. Would recommend for larger dogs since heavy buckle.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen walker

customer_reviews.title: does its job
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a supplement to the pawboo harness. I needed something to hook to the anchors for when the dog went to the vet and we placed him all the way in the back of the car. it gave him room to turn around and sit up back there, but he wasn't able to get over the seat or jump out right away when the hatch was opened. Also worked good as a short leash to walk him into the vet.
customer_reviews.author: tmb15

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but swivel end hardware not confidence inspiring.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install on rear child seat clips but they should dump the swivel end hardware and have the belt directly loop around a closed end fastener. Unfortunately most other products have weaker fastening systems. Much better than using nothing though.
customer_reviews.author: bary

customer_reviews.title: Very well made!!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for to keep my dog in her dog car seat. This is much easier and stronger than what came with her dog car seat. I attached this to the hook behind the headrest of the back seat of my Honda accord. I love it and highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine P.

customer_reviews.title: Secure and convenient
customer_reviews.text: I received the Safety Belt this week, and have used it once. I love the way it clips to the metal hardware in the car, rather than clipping into one of the seatbelts. It is more convenient and at least seems to be VERY secure. Our previous belt clipped into the seatbelt, and it would come loose sometimes. We would have to remove it, too, if I had three kids in the back seat. Not the case with the Mighty Paw Safety Belt!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Eilers

customer_reviews.title: Keeps paws off windows
customer_reviews.text: One of my Heeler's (of course it's the red. It's always the Red), throws a little Cattle Dog tantrum, scratching at the vent glass on my Element whenever I get out without him. I've been able to buckle him in with just enough length to sit and stand, without enough space to claw at the glass. He doesn't like this very much. My wallet and heart enjoy not dealing with shredded Cattle Dog paws. Human: 1 Cattle Dog: 10,000
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Cattle Dog LadyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: great product to keep your dog safe in the car
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. This is the 2nd one I purchased as I just recently got a 2nd dog! It keeps the dog safe, easy to install and easy to use. I like the adjustable feature which allows me to limit the distance the dog can go.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth M. Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Prefer this to other styles
customer_reviews.text: I had another style of seatbelt that latched into the seatbelt buckle. While great for securing my pooch, it didn't allow him any movement and he hated it. This seatbelt is longer, and attaches to the latch system. It keeps him safely in place, but he can change from sitting to laying position easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Great Design
customer_reviews.text: I love this! The latch system is exactly like the one that held my son's carseat in place. The dog cannot accidentally unhook herself (as has happened with the seatbelt buckle variety). It is quick & easy to attach (and remove) the carabiner to my dog's harness. It is made of sturdy materials. I'll be buying another for my other dog.
customer_reviews.author: JCS

customer_reviews.title: Problem solved
customer_reviews.text: We just started using our new Mighty Paw Safety Belt. It instantly solved what was really a very bad problem we've had with the seat belt tether we we using for the past 10 months. Once our golden retriever was beyond the little puppy stage, she would wander a bit in the back seat to look out the windows. She would invariably step on the seat belt latch button, releasing her tether and removing her safety belt protection. That is not possible with this new safety belt. Problem solved, worry gone. I bought a second one for my son, who also has a wandering golden retriever.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H.

customer_reviews.title: Too short
customer_reviews.text: This is s little short for our needs. My pup likes at put her front paws on the console in between the two front seats, but even on the longest setting, she can’t reach. Disappointed. It seems sturdy and was easy to attach to the latch system.
customer_reviews.author: Lora Lee Hessing

customer_reviews.title: this is a great product!
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned that she wouldn't be able to reach the window but it is perfect. I now have the security that she won't get hurt should we ever be in an accident. I use it with her harness a collar might strangle a puppy or dog. I've used it for over a month and she has never been tangle up. It is a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, we bought a second!
customer_reviews.text: We have one of these for each of our cars now- we liked the first one so much that we bought the second so we didn’t need to move it back and forth. Our last doggie seatbelt clipped into the seatbelt lock, and that piece metal was so flimsy that it bent. This is a much sturdier design, I have no worries about it breaking or coming unclipped from the baby seat hooks. The hook end for her harness is great too. Overall wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: ZagGirl

customer_reviews.title: Very Versatile
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this when my mom got her pit bull mix from the shelter. She is a heavy chewer but this hasn't been damaged at all. We have it set so she can lay down on the floor of my mom's van while still wearing her harness. My little Shih Tzu had the grey/green version (it matches his harness) and it works great for him too, he prefers to stay on the seat, but we have it long enough so he can poke his head out the window. I'm about to buy another one so my cat can stay safe we move.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Best tether ever recommended by dog search and rescue/Phoenix AZ
customer_reviews.text: I volunteer in dog search and rescue and I can’t even count how many cases I have worked on where dogs have gone missing from cars. They jump out of an open window, get ejected during a crash or run off when first responders open the door to an injured owners vehicle. This tether is hands down the best I have used. I have witnessed first hand dogs stepping on the seatbelt release for the other brands that do not securely latch on. The swivel is a great feature and I like the grey color because it is more visible against my black seats.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie D

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but beware of latch getting really hot
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Does the trick but the swivel latch really should be coated with heat resistant rubber. It gets extremely hot if you leave it hooked in place in the car and you can not put it on the dog until you cool it off or you can burn your dog.
customer_reviews.author: MTMBERR

customer_reviews.title: Best Doggie Seat Belt I've Found - Own Multiples!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Mighty Paw safety belt in the last several years (all still in use) and I love feeling my babies are safely restrained while traveling. I've tried others and was not impressed. I like this one best because it attaches to the vehicle frame latch bars like children's car seats so not only is it stronger, I don't have to worry that they will unlatch it by stepping on the seat belt release. The Mighty Paw belt allows good adjustment and the restraint does not tangle and knot because of the built in swivel!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SAFETY FIRST
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have purchased because I know my dog is SAFE. This connects to the vehicle bar behind the back seat easily. I have one in my car and one to be used when traveling in someone else's car. Simple and Low Cost.
customer_reviews.author: paddycake

customer_reviews.title: Quality safety belt
customer_reviews.text: I first bought the dog safety harness by Mighty Paw for review purposes and then when I got it in the mail and saw how sturdy it was, I came right back to order the matching seat belt. Like the harness, very nice quality materials and easy to adjust. Handy how it can hook to the latch attachments in the vehicle. Between the harness and the seat belt, our dog will be much safer when travelling with us on road trips. Also nice to support other small US businesses, too!
customer_reviews.author: JenJen

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Well made but wish it could be made longer. From attachment point to my dogs neck is too short. She cannot sit up.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Modification of anchor
customer_reviews.text: Loved the concept but my dog kept twisting her back leg in the strap. I was concerned about cutting blood circulation on long trips. I moved it anchor end to the metal headrest bar that goes into the seat. Wow perfect. She had just enough strap to move around some but still secured No more tangled little legs.
customer_reviews.author: churchlady

customer_reviews.title: super happy with it!
customer_reviews.text: love how it adjusts for easy unhooking. my pup loves it and seems super chill when shes connected. only had it a couple weeks and she is still growing. might need to upgrade size. will buy again if needed!
customer_reviews.author: heather s. macmillan

customer_reviews.title: Only 24" long max. Almost to short.
customer_reviews.text: The length is my only issue, at 24" my black lab with a harness is a really tight fit. Would be nice if you had more adjustment in length.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff K. Latham

product_meta.title: Mighty Paw Safety Belt, Dog Seat Belt, Heavy Duty Hardware Including Tangle-Free Swivel Attachment, Carabiner, and Latch Bar Attachment.
feature_bullets: SAFETY: Designed for optimal pet safety and security. The Mighty Paw Safety Belt attaches directly to the vehicle frame using the latch bars located in the crease of every vehicle’s backseat. The federal government requires these latch bars in all vehicles concluding that they “increase child restraint effectiveness and child safety”. Here at Mighty Paw we believe if there is a safer option for our children, then our pets deserve it too!

DEPENDABLE: Other pet seat belt systems can accidentally be released if the dog steps on the buckle button. This cannot happen with the Mighty Paw Safety Belt as we use a secure hook attaching directly to the vehicle’s latch bar. To attach to the dog's harness, the Mighty Paw Safety Belt uses an easy to grasp, durable, carabiner that allows for a quick release in case of an emergency. The carabiner is made of extra strong, yet lightweight, AVIATION ALUMINUM with a Max Force Tension of 400 KG!

COMFORT: Our easy adjustable tri-glide attachment can extend from 16 inches to 26 inches allowing for more or less freedom based on the size of your dog. Also, we’ve cleverly included a tangle-free attachment that will allow the dog to rotate and move around without ever tangling.

BUILT FOR THE YEARS: The Safety Belt is made with high quality weather-proof nylon and ALL-METAL (not plastic!) hardware for optimal toughness and durability that will ensure its use for years to come.

CONVENIENCE: The Mighty Paw Safety Belt can be easily removed OR stay attached to your vehicle’s latch bar at all times. No more time and energy spent hooking and unhooking your pets seat belt. It is convenient and ready to use when your four-legged friend is a passenger.
